events.title: Eighth Army's Strategic Directive: G.H.Q. Issues Operation Instruction No. 111
events.description: G.H.Q., M.E.F. Operation Insiruction No, 111. Lieutenant-General N. M. Ritchie, Commander, Eighth Army. 11th February 1942.

events.title: Malaya Command HQ Relocates to Fort Canning as Sime Road Faces Growing Threat
events.description: 527. At o745 hrs. 11th February Advanced Headquarters Malaya Command closed at Sime Road, which was now closely threatened, and moved to Fort Canning.

events.title: Progress Hampered: Enemy Attack Halts Key Rail Line Reestablishment Plans
events.description: (b) To secure by ogoo hours 11th February a line from a point east of Keat Hong Village to Ulu Pandan. (c) To re-establish by r800 hours rth February the Kranji-Jurong Switch Line. The first advance involved only a slight readjustment of the line and was effected without difficulty. An enemy attack and penetration during the night, however, prevented the - fulfilment of the remainder of the plan, which subsequently had to be cancelled.

events.title: War in the Skies: Allocation of Army Co-Operation Squadrons Revealed (Feb-Apr 1941)

Ir iss) Division 4x Squadron less 1 ight. 12 (Affican) Division One Flight 41  uadron.   I (South African) Division 4o Squadron. Mar. 3rd redistribution:   Ir Gita) Division One Flight 41 Squadron. io Division One Flight 41 Under Force Control 4x Squadron H.Q. less 2 Flights. I (South African) Division 4o Squadron.

events.title: Stealthy Night Assault: 22nd Brigade Captures Afimadu as Enemy Forces Withdraw
events.description: 50. On 11th February 22nd Brigade Group, rath (A) Division, attacked Afimadu which was in our hands  by 0700 hours, the bulk of the enemy garrison having withdrawn during the night. 24th Gold Coast Brigade Group were passed through Afmadu that night directed on Bulo Erillo and Gobuen respectively. At this period it was thought advisable to carry out all moves at night, both to conceal our lines of advance, and to avoid air action against our columns.
